citations.narrative:
In response to a complaint filed with the USDA dated March 17, 2025, a follow up USDA visit to the facility was made on
April 22, 2025. During this vist, it was found that the facility was continuing to exhibit USDA regulated animal species
(guinea pigs and budgerigars), without a valid USDA license. The facility submitted an initial application for USDA
licensure in February of 2024 but has not yet completed licensing requirements for conducting regulated activity as
outlined under the Animal Welfare Act.
This facility was previously cited by USDA inspectors for non-compliance under 2.1(a)(1) of the Animal Welfare Act during
USDA visits to the facility on November 11, 2024 and August 05, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.1(a)(1)  Repeat
   
Requirements and application. 
In response to a complaint filed with the USDA dated March 17, 2025, a follow up USDA visit to the facility was made on 
April 22, 2025. During this vist, it was found that the facility was continuing to exhibit USDA regulated animal species 
(guinea pigs and budgerigars), without a valid USDA license. The facility submitted an initial application for USDA 
licensure in February of 2024 but has not yet completed licensing requirements for conducting regulated activity as 
outlined under the Animal Welfare Act.  
 
This facility was previously cited by USDA inspectors for non-compliance under 2.1(a)(1) of the Animal Welfare Act during 
USDA visits to the facility on November 11, 2024 and August 05, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
